questions.question: How did the location of the Korean peninsula influence the develpment of Korean civilization?

choices.answer: Near Japan it was influenced by Japanese culture/politics
On the Bay of Bengal influenced by India
Near China, Korea strongly influenced Chinese culture
Near China, Korea was influenced by Chinese culture

questions.question: Which statement best describes Korea's relationship with China during early dynasties?

choices.answer: China influenced Koreas culture
Korea was more powerful than China causing Chinese anger
Korea influenced China's culture
Korea / Japan presented a clear and present danger to China

questions.question: What inference can you make about Japanese attitudes toward Korean culture in the late 1500's?

choices.answer: The Japanese looked down on Korean culture   /invaded China
Looked down on Korean culture and mocked their "turtle ships
Japanese admired Korean culture/took  their artisans
Japanese admired their language and fit it to Japanese lang

questions.question: Which of the following is an example of how Korea adapted or modified Chinese ideas?

choices.answer: They invented hangul; a modified form of Chinese writing
They exported Buddism to China
They created celadon from Chinese porcelain
They improved on Chinas moveable type to  woodblock printing

questions.question: Why might Korea's location be considered strategic by other countries?

choices.answer: its location to the Sea of Japan makes it hard to invade
Its location on a peninsula allows for trendous farmland
its location to Japan prevents other contries from influence
its location next to China gives it access to that country

questions.question: Which two geographical elements had the greatest effect on Korea's development?

choices.answer: its rivers and forests
its seacoast and its islands
its mountains and its seacoasts
its mountains and its inland plains

questions.question: During the Silla dynasty, the most powerful cultural influence on Korea was?

choices.answer: India
Japan
Mongolia
China

questions.question: The first followers of Buddism in Korea were?

choices.answer: soldiers and merchants
rulers and nobles
peasants and farmers
aristocrats and civil servants

questions.question: One of the most important effects of the introduction of hangul during the Choson dynasty was?

choices.answer: an increase in the literacy rate
easier communication with China
the replacement of Buddhism with Confucianism
an increase in the production of celadon pottery
